revised_title: Atmospherical Electricity: Observations and Experiments at Knightsbridge
tldr: This article describes the author's meteorological journal, focusing on atmospheric electricity observed at Knightsbridge from May 9, 1790, to May 8, 1791. The author details the setup of his experimental apparatus, which includes a rod, glass pillar, and pith balls, and discusses his observations of the effects of rain, humidity, and temperature on the electricity. He also notes the correlation between thunderstorms and changes in the apparatus' electrical state.
